case_title: AHMED KHAN vs GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN through Secretary S&GAD, Civil Secretariat, Quetta and another
respondent: Government of Balochistan through Secretary S&GAD, Civil Secretariat, Quetta and another

key_points.appeal_basis: Promotion to B-19 on the basis of seniority-cum-fitness, length of service, and availability of vacancy.
key_points.respondent_arguments: Promotion is not a vested right and depends on seniority, competence, and other factors.
court_findings: Promotion is not an automatic right and requires consideration of multiple factors.
PSB-I recommended Mr. Lutufullah Khosa for promotion based on seniority and available vacancy.
Government has the prerogative to amend service rules and promotion policies.
relevant_cases_cited: Syed Noor Hassan v. The Secretary, Ministry of Industries, Government of Pakistan, Islamabad and others [1987 SCMR 598]
Government of Pakistan through Establishment Division, Islamabad and 7 others v. Hameed Akhtar Niazi [PLD 2003 SC 110]
Dr. Omer Farooq Zain v. Bahauddin Zakariya University, Multan [2008 PLC (C.S.) 1012]
Dr. Allyas Qadeer v. Secretary Ministry of Education, Islamabad and others [2014 SCMR 997]
observations: Balochistan Agriculture College Service Rules, 1993 lacked provisions for length of service and publication of research papers.
PSB-I advised amendments to the service rules to address these deficiencies.

final_decision: Appeal dismissed with no order as to costs.
